intro: Sarcozona bicarinata, commonly known as the two-edged sea hare, is a species of sea slug found in tropical marine environments. It belongs to the family Anithaeridae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated body and vibrant coloration. The species is notable for its unique anatomical features, including a specialized radula and a complex reproductive system. It plays a role in marine ecosystems as both a predator and a prey species. Its botanical classification places it within the order Sacoglossa, reflecting its evolutionary relationships with other marine gastropods.
